Text: Conicosia is a genus of succulent plants in the ice plant family native to southern Africa.
Triplets:<Conicosia
1:
--------------------
Text: Conicosia:  They are known commonly as narrow-leafed ice plants.
Triplets:<Conicosia
2:
--------------------
<Text: Conicosia:  These are relatively short-lived perennials with underground stems and tentacle-shaped, dull-pointed triangular leaves.>
Triplets:<Conicosia
3:
--------------------
Text: Conicosia:  They bear large tubular flowers often exceeding 10 centimeters in width, with up to 250 fringelike petals arranged in a ring around a center with hundreds of stamens.
Triplets:<Conicosia
4:
--------------------
<Text: Conicosia:  The fruit is a capsule which opens when it gets wet, slowly releasing the hundreds of tiny seeds as they fall out of its drying flesh.>
